name: Chessboard (CyberneticSquid)
description:
I wanted to finally get around to completing a project. So I opened up Godot and made a chessboard. It's pretty simple, but some of its features could be useful for playing a few chess variants.

Note that you can hold shift while letting go of a piece to stop it being snapped to the grid, if you want. There, uh, wasn't really room in the help sheet to put that in.

MacOS users, note that:
  1. Control does mean Control here, not Command.
  2. Ctrl+O to open the save folder doesn't work for reasons unknown to me.
If you want to get to the save folder manually, find it at: Linux:~/.local/share/godot/app_userdata/ChessboardWindows:%APPDATA%\Chessboard or %APPDATA%\Godot\app_userdata\ChessboardmacOS:~/Library/Application Support/Godot/app_userdata/Chessboard

Credits:
  • Font: Unscii
  • Colour Palette: Spark
  • Engine: As stated previously, Godot

One closing note: This is my first time uploading to itch.io, so please do not hesitate to let me know if I've done something wrong.
